I should be careful to seal any focuses or similar that I sign, as acquiring an unsealed signed focus may allow someone to impersonate me, and Erase Item gets rid of the signature.

Signature Purification.name: checksignature
Signature Purification.description: Accepts a soulprint, and checks if the item in my other hand is engraved with it. Returns true if so, false otherwise. Costs a negligible amount of media.

Conduct Rod.name: craftrod
Conduct Rod.description: Acts just like the spells used to program conventional casting items. Costs 10 Charged Amethyst.

Noetic Gateway.name: dimteleport
Noetic Gateway.description: Accepts an entity and a Spatial Imprint and teleports the entity to its position in the corresponding dimension. Costs 20 Charged Amethyst.

Media Infusion.name: infusemedia
Media Infusion.description: Accepts a vector and infuses media into the corresponding block in order to transmute it. Cost and exact effect vary depending on target.

Spatial Interchange.name: swapspace
Spatial Interchange.description: Accepts two lists of two vectors, to define two cuboids, and a Spatial Imprint. These cuboids must have the exact same dimensions and rotation.

Stealth Shroud.name: resistdetection
Stealth Shroud.description: Accepts a living entity and a number (n), and shields the entity from hex-based detection for n seconds. Costs two amethyst dust per second.

Uplifting Resonance.name: applynotmissing
Uplifting Resonance.description: Accepts a living entity, and allows it to be accessed from anywhere for one minute. Has a base cost of one amethyst shard, plus one additional shard per application before allowing it to expire.

Empower Mind Render.name: applymindrender
Empower Mind Render.description: Accepts an item or item frame bearing the Sharpness enchantment, and converts it into Mind Render of the same level. Cost is based on enchantment level, and increases by 50% if the item is a book.

Instill Psyche.name: reviveflayed
Instill Psyche.description: Accepts a flayed mob, and creates an artifical pseudo-mind to inhabit its body. Costs 16 charged amethyst when used on a villager, or 10 amethyst shards for anything else.

Library Key.name: library
Library Key.description: It started with a crack... A small thing really. I felt a light breeze from it that told me things. I'm now certain that every mind has some form of physical representation. I just need to get there. If only I could push that crack wider...

Visitor's Key.name: visit_library
Visitor's Key.description: I should also keep in mind that this method only seems to work on those like myself. Those of us who have "opened" our minds to the realm around us.

Klein's Chest.name: kleins_chest
Klein's Chest.description: The cost of using this mental storage is an amethyst shard plus a quarter of an amethyst dust per slot filled. It takes a surprisingly large amount of mental energy to recall things that shouldn't be there in the first place.

Debugger's Reflection.name: const/debugging
Debugger's Reflection.description: Adds True to the top of the stack if executed by a Debugger, or False otherwise.

Set Breakpoint Before.name: breakpoint/before
Set Breakpoint Before.description: Pauses the Debugger before executing this pattern.

Set Breakpoint After.name: breakpoint/after
Set Breakpoint After.description: Pauses the Debugger after executing this pattern (ie. before executing the next pattern).

Craft Debugger.name: craft/debugger
Craft Debugger.description: Creates a Debugger that casts a Hex, similar to certain other patterns I've used in the past.Costs about ten Charged Amethyst.

Bind Figment.name: set_fake_impetus_player
Bind Figment.description: Removes a vector from the stack and binds a Figment to the block at the position represented by the vector. I can't tell what the target is supposed to be though.

Hex Shield.name: create_shield/normal
Hex Shield.description: Removes a position vector, facing vector, and a positive number from the stack, creating a Hex Shield with the given position and facing, which will last for the given number of seconds. Costs 2 Amethyst Dust per second of duration.

Unstable Hex Shield.name: create_shield/glitchy
Unstable Hex Shield.description: Creates an unstable Hex Shield, which will occasionally distort. The effect appears purely visual.

Duelist's Purification.name: get_main_hand
Duelist's Purification.description: Transforms the entity at the top of the stack into the Item Stack in its main hand. Also works on Item Frames and dropped items.

Shieldbearer's Purification.name: get_off_hand
Shieldbearer's Purification.description: Transforms the entity at the top of the stack into the Item Stack in its off hand.

Hoarder's Distillation.name: get_inventory/stacks
Hoarder's Distillation.description: Removes two vectors from the stack representing position and side. Returns a list of Item Stacks in the block at the given position accessible from the given side (or all if second vector is zero).

Collector's Distillation.name: get_inventory/items
Collector's Distillation.description: Removes two vectors from the stack representing position and side. Returns a list of Items in the block at the given position accessible from the given side (or all if second vector is zero).

Logistician's Purification.name: get_stack_prop/item
Logistician's Purification.description: Transforms the Item Stack at the top of the stack into its Item.

Treasurer's Purification.name: get_stack_prop/size
Treasurer's Purification.description: Transforms the Item Stack at the top of the stack into its size.

Revolving Distillation.name: pattern/rotate
Revolving Distillation.description: Removes a pattern and an integer from the stack and rotates the pattern the number of times given by the integer. Positive numbers rotate clockwise, while negative rotate counter-clockwise.

Painter's Distillation.name: pattern/merge
Painter's Distillation.description: Removes two patterns and merges them, as if first stroke of the second was drawn from the last point of the first. It appears if the result is longer than 128 strokes, its end will be lost entirely.

Starting Distillation.name: pattern/head
Starting Distillation.description: Removes a pattern and a number N from the stack. N must be between 1 and the number of strokes in the removed pattern. Returns a pattern composed of the first N strokes of the removed pattern, preserving the original pattern's direction.

Ending Distillation.name: pattern/tail
Ending Distillation.description: Removes a pattern and a number from the stack. Behaves exactly as Starting Distillation but takes the last strokes of the pattern instead of the first.

Winding Purification.name: pattern/start_dir
Winding Purification.description: Removes a pattern from the stack and returns a number from 0 to 5 representing the pattern's starting direction. The returned number will be 0 for north-east, 1 for east, and continue to increase clockwise.

Fragment's Purification.name: pattern/line_count
Fragment's Purification.description: Removes a pattern from the stack and returns the number of strokes the removed pattern is composed of.

Memorize Pigment.name: colorizer/save
Memorize Pigment.description: Removes a pattern from the stack and associates my current Pigment with that pattern.

Recall Pigment.name: colorizer/load
Recall Pigment.description: Removes a pattern from the stack and sets my current Pigment to the one I have associated with that pattern

Forget Pigment.name: colorizer/delete
Forget Pigment.description: Removes a pattern from the stack, and forgets the Pigment I have associated with that pattern.

Automaton's Reflection.name: construct_get_self
Automaton's Reflection.description: If executed by a Construct, puts a reference to it on the stack. Otherwise, causes a Mishap. Should be used instead of Mind's Reflection for Hexes executed by Constructs.

Command: Pick Up Item.name: give_command/pick_up
Command: Pick Up Item.description: Removes an entity representing a dropped item from the stack and instructs the Construct to pick it up. The item must be next to the Construct, the construct must be able to pick items up and not be carrying one already.

Command: Drop Item.name: give_command/drop_off
Command: Drop Item.description: Instructs the Construct to drop the item it is currently carrying. The construct must be able carrying an item.

Command: Move To Position.name: give_command/move_to
Command: Move To Position.description: Removes a vector from the stack and instructs the Construct to go to the position represented by that vector. The position must be within 32 blocks of the Construct.

Command: Harvest.name: give_command/harvest
Command: Harvest.description: Removes a vector from the stack and instructs the Construct to harvest crops or berries at the position represented by that vector. If harvesting the block destroys it, it will be replanted by the Construct. The position must be next to the Construct, and the Construct must be capable of interacting with the world.

Command: Use On Block.name: give_command/use/block
Command: Use On Block.description: Removes two vectors from the stack and instructs the Construct to use the currently held item, if any, on the block represented by the first vector.

Send Instructions.name: instructions/send
Send Instructions.description: Some basic patterns to close off the introduction. Remove a reference to a Construct and a list of patterns from the stack and send the list as instructions to the Construct.

Broadcast Instructions.name: instructions/broadcast
Broadcast Instructions.description: Removes a vector and a list of patterns. Broadcasts the list as instructions through the Broadcaster located at the indicated position.

Artificer's Gambit.name: bind_construct
Artificer's Gambit.description: Removes a reference to a player, a pattern, or Null from the stack, and binds the Construct to it.

Create Spider Construct.name: create_construct/spider
Create Spider Construct.description: The inputs represent, starting from deepest on the stack, the Allay, a dropped Core, and a dropped fully-charged Battery. The items are consumed, and the Allay is converted into a Construct.

Entity Purification: Construct.name: get_entity/construct
Entity Purification: Construct.description: Transform the position on the stack into the Construct at that location (or Null if there isn't one).

Zone Distillation: Construct.name: zone_entity/construct
Zone Distillation: Construct.description: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of Constructs near the position.

Zone Distillation: Non-Construct.name: zone_entity/not_construct
Zone Distillation: Non-Construct.description: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of non-Construct entities near the position.

Schr\u00f6dinger's Reflection.name: create_property
Schr\u00f6dinger's Reflection.description: Pushes a reference to a random property. Costs one charged amethyst to burn this property into the universe.

Observation Purification.name: observe_property
Observation Purification.description: Observes the current value of the property iota. Free to use.

Schr\u00f6dinger's Gambit.name: set_property
Schr\u00f6dinger's Gambit.description: Sets the property iota. Costs about a tenth of a dust. All future observations of the property iota return the new value.

Offer Mind.name: offer_mind
Offer Mind.description: Can be cast by both me and the genie to borrow the experiences and memory of a villager. The spell itself costs one charged amethyst, plus the media I'm giving.

Educate Genie.name: educate_genie
Educate Genie.description: Teaches the presence my intentions. Because I am teaching an entity rather than etching a casting device, I can freely revise the Hex and reteach the genie any time without losing the media.

Genie Reflection: Spatial.name: get_hand_lamp_position
Genie Reflection: Spatial.description: Pushes my original position when I began using the lamp.

Genie Reflection: Rotational.name: get_hand_lamp_rotation
Genie Reflection: Rotational.description: Pushes my original rotation when I began using the lamp.

Genie Reflection: Kinetic.name: get_hand_lamp_velocity
Genie Reflection: Kinetic.description: Pushes my original velocity when I began using the lamp.

Genie Reflection: Temporal.name: get_hand_lamp_use_time
Genie Reflection: Temporal.description: Pushes how many times the lamp has cast. Divided by 20, it is the number of seconds since I began using the lamp.

Genie Reflection: Media.name: get_hand_lamp_media
Genie Reflection: Media.description: Pushes the remaining media of the lamp, in units of dust.

Genie Reflection: Memory.name: get_hand_lamp_storage
Genie Reflection: Memory.description: Retrieves an iota from my hand lamp's internal storage, returns null by default.

Genie Gambit.name: set_hand_lamp_storage
Genie Gambit.description: Sets an internal storage of my lamp to any iota. Strangely allows bypassing the Transgress Others mishap, perhaps because it requires my active concentration to use this lamp.

Archgenie Reflection: Spatial.name: get_arch_lamp_position
Archgenie Reflection: Spatial.description: Pushes the original position of the caster when the arch lamp started casting.

Archgenie Reflection: Rotational.name: get_arch_lamp_rotation
Archgenie Reflection: Rotational.description: Pushes the original rotation of the caster when the arch lamp started casting.

Archgenie Reflection: Kinetic.name: get_arch_lamp_velocity
Archgenie Reflection: Kinetic.description: Pushes the original velocity of the caster when the arch lamp started casting.

Archgenie Reflection: Temporal.name: get_arch_lamp_use_time
Archgenie Reflection: Temporal.description: Pushes how many times the lamp has cast. Divided by 20, it returns how many times in seconds the lamp has been in use.

Archgenie Gambit.name: set_arch_lamp_storage
Archgenie Gambit.description: Sets the lamp's iota storage. Subject to Transgress Others mishap.

Archgenie Reflection: Media.name: get_arch_lamp_media
Archgenie Reflection: Media.description: Pushes the remaining amount of media left in the lamp, in units of dust.

Activate Archgenie.name: activate_arch_lamp
Activate Archgenie.description: Can be cast by a casting device, staff, or within an arch lamp. Deactivates any archgenie lamp and activates a previously inactive one.

Terminate Archgenie.name: terminate_arch_lamp
Terminate Archgenie.description: Can be cast by a casting device, staff, or within the arch lamp itself. Deactivates the currently active archgenie lamp.

Archgenie Purification.name: has_arch_lamp
Archgenie Purification.description: Pushes whether a player currently has an active arch lamp.

Finale Reflection.name: lamp_finale
Finale Reflection.description: When an archgenie lamp is turned off, it casts an additional time. I can use this pattern to recognize when whether a cast is that last burst of energy.

Age Scroll.name: age_scroll
Age Scroll.description: Yellows the parchment of the scroll, making it bear striking semblance to some ancient scrolls I've been finding.

Dye Ink.name: color_scroll
Dye Ink.description: Changes the color of a living scroll's ink to the color specified by the vector, with the components being 0 to 1 values of red, green, and blue respectively.

Illuminate Ink.name: glow_scroll
Illuminate Ink.description: Causes the ink of a living scroll to brightly glow in the dark.

Vanish Scroll.name: vanish_scroll
Vanish Scroll.description: Causes the scroll paper to become invisible, leaving only the pattern, making it appear as though the pattern were magically etched into the surface.

Librarian's Purification.name: read_shelf
Librarian's Purification.description: Reads the iota from an akashic bookshelf within ambit. Free to cast.

Librarian's Gambit.name: write_shelf
Librarian's Gambit.description: Writes an iota under a pattern to an akashic bookshelf within ambit. Free to cast.

Displace.name: displace
Displace.description: For absolutely free, I can teleport an entity in my circle to anywhere else inside within the same circle. Unlike Greater Teleport, takes in world coordinates rather than an offset.

Theodolite's Purification.name: theodolite
Theodolite's Purification.description: Similar to Alidade's Purification but pushes the vector that points upwards from their head rather than the entity's facing vector.

Caliper's Purification.name: entity_width
Caliper's Purification.description: Similar to Stadiometer's Purification but pushes the width of an entity rather than its height.

Similarity Distillation.name: similar
Similarity Distillation.description: Pushes whether two iota are of the same type.

Congruence Distillation.name: congruent
Congruence Distillation.description: Pushes whether two patterns have the same shape, even if they have different orientations.

Dioscuri Gambit II.name: dup_many
Dioscuri Gambit II.description: Takes a number and duplicates that many elements of the stack while preserving order.

Glyphmaker's Distillation.name: shuffle_pattern
Glyphmaker's Distillation.description: Takes in a pattern and a number and produces a pattern of the same shape, but different stroke order. My notes reveal that ancient hexcasters used this for some grand library.

Soroban Reflection II.name: soroban_decrement
Soroban Reflection II.description: Pushes the current soroban counter and then decreases it.

Soroban Reflection.name: soroban_increment
Soroban Reflection.description: Pushes the current soroban counter and then increases it.

Naval Distillation.name: fluid_raycast
Naval Distillation.description: Works similar to Archer's Distillation but targets only liquids, piercing through all other blocks.

Lilypad Distillation.name: fluid_surface_raycast
Lilypad Distillation.description: Works similar to Architect's Distillation but targets only liquids, piercing through all other blocks.

Railgun Exaltation.name: piercing_raycast
Railgun Exaltation.description: Works similar to Archer's Distillation but accepts an additional identifier. It will pierce all blocks until it hits the block specified by the identifier.

Laser Exaltation.name: piercing_surface_raycast
Laser Exaltation.description: Works similar to Architect's Distillation but accepts an additional identifier. It will pierce all blocks until it hits the block specified by the identifier.

Telepathic Reflection.name: get_telepathy
Telepathic Reflection.description: By focusing on a particular image, I can detect that concentration via this pattern. Pushes how long I have been holding down the telepathy key, or -1 if I am not holding it.

Send Thought.name: send_telepathy
Send Thought.description: Momentarily displays the iota above my hotbar. If cast repeatedly, each cast overwrites the previous message instantly.

Shout Thought.name: shout_telepathy
Shout Thought.description: Displays a iota across my screen. It obstructs my vision and takes some time to fade in, so I shall only use it sparingly.

Hallucinate Pling.name: pling
Hallucinate Pling.description: Causes me to hear a pling that is inaudible to other players.

Hallucinate Click.name: click
Hallucinate Click.description: Causes me to hear a click that is inaudible to other players.

Dodge Reflection.name: moving_left
Dodge Reflection.description: Pushes how long I've been intending to move leftwards, or -1. Can be easily differentiated from Evade Reflection because d comes to the left of e.

Evade Reflection.name: moving_right
Evade Reflection.description: Pushes how long I've been intending to move rightwards, or -1. Can be easily differentiated from Dodge Reflection because e comes to the right of d.

Charge Reflection.name: moving_up
Charge Reflection.description: Pushes how long I've been intending to move forwards, or -1 if I am not pressing the forwards key.

Retreat Reflection.name: moving_down
Retreat Reflection.description: Pushes how long I've been intending to move backwards, or -1 if I am not pressing the backwards key.

Leaping Reflection.name: jumping
Leaping Reflection.description: Pushes how long I've been intending to jump, or -1 if I am not pressing the jump key.

Perlin Distillation.name: perlin
Perlin Distillation.description: Measures the concentration of ambient at that point in space and time, normalized between 0 and 1.

Epiphany Purification.name: am_enlightened
Epiphany Purification.description: Pushes whether the given player has achieved enlightenment like I have.

Sentience Purification.name: is_brainswept
Sentience Purification.description: Pushes whether an entity "has been magically relieved of its mind". I feel this is strongly related to Flay Mind somehow...

Conjure Hexburst.name: conjure_hexburst
Conjure Hexburst.description: Conjures a hexburst at the location with the given iota. Costs one dust. Is subject to the Transgress Others mishap.

Conjure Hextito.name: conjure_hextito
Conjure Hextito.description: Conjures a hextito at the location. Costs two dust. Is subject to the Transgress Others mishap.

Chorus Blink.name: chorus_blink
Chorus Blink.description: Between Blink, Greater Teleport, ender pearls, and chorus fruit, this spell serves a harmonious midpoint for safe, precise, and cheap teleportation.

Gasp.name: gasp
Gasp.description: Instantly replenishes a creature's air bubbles, always costs one dust.

Chromatic Purification.name: get_dye
Chromatic Purification.description: Gets the dye of a block or entity.

Dye.name: dye
Dye.description: Dyes a dyeable block or entity. Costs an eighth of a dust.

Vision Purification.name: translate_dye
Vision Purification.description: Translates a dye color into a vector, where each component is from 0 to 1 and represents the red, green, and blueness of the dye respectively.

Pigment Distillation.name: sample_pigment
Pigment Distillation.description: Samples my pigment color at a certain place and time as a vector, where each component is from 0 to 1 and represents the red, green, and blueness of the dye respectively.

Wristpocket.name: wristpocket
Wristpocket.description: This spell vanishes the stack of items in my other hand, or conjures it back, swapping if my other hand is holding something. Costs 1/8th of a dust if an item is inserted or swapped in.

Pocket Reflection.name: wristpocket_item
Pocket Reflection.description: Returns the identifier of the item in my wristpocket, or null if it is empty.

Pocket Reflection II.name: wristpocket_count
Pocket Reflection II.description: Returns how many items I have in my wristpocket, or 0 if it is empty.

Mage Hand.name: mage_hand
Mage Hand.description: Conjures a magical hand that uses my wristpocketed item to interact with the world. If my wristpocket is empty, acts as though I had interacted with the world.

Assimilate Food.name: ingest
Assimilate Food.description: This spell makes me eat my wristpocketed item, nourishing or applying potions to me. Regardless of the item's time to eat or if I'm full, this spell makes me consume it instantly.

Prestidigitation.name: prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description: Causes a small magical effect on the block or entity, usually not too distinct from the original nature or function of the block or entity. Costs 1/10th dust.

Alteration Purification.name: can_prestidigitate
Alteration Purification.description: Pushes whether an entity or location is able to be manipulated with Prestidigitation.

Magic Missile.name: magic_missile
Magic Missile.description: Conjures a small silver of amethyst that always deals a full heart of damage and decent knockback. Costs one amethyst dust.

Conjure Compass.name: conjure_compass
Conjure Compass.description: Conjures a compass at the location pointing towards the second vector. Costs three dust.

Conjure Spike.name: spike
Conjure Spike.description: Takes a non-air position, an axis vector, and a delay in seconds up to ten seconds long and conjures a spike at that location. Costs one shard.

Conjure Speck.name: conjure_speck
Conjure Speck.description: Conjures a speck with the iota, position, and rotation. Costs one-hundredth of a dust. Pushes the speck iota to the stack.

Move Speck.name: move_specklike
Move Speck.description: Moves a speck entity to the position.

Rotate Speck.name: rotate_specklike
Rotate Speck.description: Rotates a speck entity to face the vector.

Roll Speck.name: roll_specklike
Roll Speck.description: Accepts a number between 0 and 1, representing a fraction of a full rotation, and rotates the speck's image by that amount.

Resize Speck.name: size_specklike
Resize Speck.description: Scales the speck, can range from 0 to 10. Represents size in blocks and is zero by default.

Thicken Speck.name: thickness_specklike
Thicken Speck.description: Changes the stroke thickness of a pattern speck, can range from 0 to 10. Represents twentieths of a block, and is zero by default.

Time Speck.name: lifetime_specklike
Time Speck.description: Commands the speck to disappear after that many twentieths of a second.

Zone Distillation: Speck.name: zone_specklike
Zone Distillation: Speck.description: Returns specks similarly to other zone distillation patterns.

Conjure Mage Block.name: conjure_mage_block
Conjure Mage Block.description: Conjures a mage block at the location. Costs three dust.I can create a city out of nothing, or I can cover it in volcanic rock.

Modify Block: Bouncy.name: modify_block_bouncy
Modify Block: Bouncy.description: This modifier makes the block delightfully fun to bounce on! It returns more force to me than regular slime blocks and I notice even if I sneak, the block bounces me regardless.

Modify Block: Energized.name: modify_block_energized
Modify Block: Energized.description: This modifier makes the block emit a Redstone signal, with the number corresponding to the power level of the output.

Modify Block: Ephemeral.name: modify_block_ephemeral
Modify Block: Ephemeral.description: This modifier takes in a number in addition to a position and shatters the block after many twentieths of a second. Subsequent casts can lengthen or shorten the duration.

Modify Block: Invisible.name: modify_block_invisible
Modify Block: Invisible.description: This modifier prevents the block from emitting the telltale particles that accompany my casting, even when being stood on.

Modify Block: Replaceable.name: modify_block_replaceable
Modify Block: Replaceable.description: This modifier is useful for construction! With this modifier applied, I find I can easily place another block in the place of the mage block.

Modify Block: Semi-Permeable.name: modify_block_semipermeable
Modify Block: Semi-Permeable.description: This modifier makes the block semi-permeable, only allowing the last caster of it to pass through while all other entities can not.

Modify Block: Volatile.name: modify_block_volatile
Modify Block: Volatile.description: This modifier makes the block break other mage blocks it's touching. Notably, if it breaks another volatile block, that block breaks and so on until every volatile block shatters.

Conjure Staff.name: conjure_staff
Conjure Staff.description: Conjures a staff at the location with the amount of media, rank, and Hex respectively.This is my staff. There are many like it, but this one is mine.

Staff Gambit.name: write_staff
Staff Gambit.description: Writes an iota to the conjured staff's inner storage. Does not allow player references.

Staff Reflection.name: read_staff
Staff Reflection.description: Reads the iota from the conjured staff's inner storage.

Conjure Firework.name: conjure_firework
Conjure Firework.args: vec, vec, num, num, [dye], [dye], bool, bool →
Conjure Firework.description: Conjures a firework of my exact specifications. It is one of the most complex spells I've discovered. Costs the same as the other firework spell.

Simulate Firework.name: simulate_firework
Simulate Firework.description: Analyzes the firework star in my other hand and conjures a firework, with position, velocity, and flight time related to gunpowder amount. Costs one shard plus one dust for each additional gunpowder.

Greater Blink.name: greater_blink
Greater Blink.description: Teleports me up to 128 blocks away, relative to my position and rotation. Costs two dust.

Conjure Mesh.name: conjure_mesh
Conjure Mesh.description: Conjures a mesh with the location and leaves a mesh entity on the stack. Cost one dust.

Weave Mesh.name: weave_mesh
Weave Mesh.description: Takes a list of vectors, with constraints defined on the prior page, and weaves the mesh into that shape for free.

Tangle Purification.name: read_mesh
Tangle Purification.description: Reads the shape of a mesh as a list of relative vectors. Can be used to copy meshes.

Internalize Hex.name: internalize_hex
Internalize Hex.description: Internalizes a hex, allowing me to evoke that spell by pressing the R key to use it even without a staff. Costs one charged amethyst for etching process.

Evoker Purification.name: is_evoking
Evoker Purification.description: Pushes how long since a player has been trying to evoke. Resets to 0 with every successful evocation and is -1 if they are not currently evoking.

Genie Reflection.name: with_hand_lamp
Genie Reflection.description: Pushes whether this Hex is being cast by a handheld genie lamp.

Archgenie Reflection.name: with_arch_lamp
Archgenie Reflection.description: Pushes whether this Hex is currently being cast by an arch lamp.

Wand Reflection.name: with_conjured_staff
Wand Reflection.description: Pushes whether this Hex is currently being cast by a conjured staff.

Evoker Reflection.name: with_evocation
Evoker Reflection.description: Pushes whether evocation is being used to cast this pattern.

Write Grimoire.name: write_grimoire
Write Grimoire.description: Writes a pattern-to-pattern-list binding into the grimoire in my offhand.

Erase Grimoire.name: erase_grimoire
Erase Grimoire.description: Erases the pattern-list binding to the pattern in the grimoire in my offhand if it exists.

Archivist Reflection.name: index_grimoire
Archivist Reflection.description: Gets a list of all patterns stored in the grimoire.

Detective's Purification.name: identify
Detective's Purification.description: Pushes the identifier of an entity or block at a vector.

Recognizer's Purification.name: recognize
Recognizer's Purification.description: Pushes extra identifier information of an entity, mainly the item type of an item entity or the item type inside an item frame entity.

Tool Purification.name: get_mainhand_stack
Tool Purification.description: Returns the type of item in my mainhand.

Accessory Purification.name: get_offhand_stack
Accessory Purification.description: Returns the type of item in my offhand.

Meterologist's Reflection.name: get_weather
Meterologist's Reflection.description: Pushes a number corresponding to the weather. 0 for clear, 1 for rain, and 2 for thundering.

Plane Reflection.name: get_dimension
Plane Reflection.description: Pushes the identifier of the dimension the Hex is being cast in.

Temporal Reflection.name: get_time
Temporal Reflection.description: Pushes the age of the world in seconds.

Luminance Purification (get_light).name: get_light
Luminance Purification (get_light).description: Pushes the light level at the position as a number 0 to 15. If inside a nontransparent block, it returns zero.

Geographical Purification.name: get_biome
Geographical Purification.description: Pushes the identifier of the biome type that the vector is within.

Storage Purification.name: count_stack
Storage Purification.description: Takes in an item entity and pushes how many items are in it.

Deterioration Purification.name: damage_stack
Deterioration Purification.description: Takes in an item entity and pushes how much damage the item has sustained.

Miner's Purification.name: block_hardness
Miner's Purification.description: Pushes how difficult blocks of that block type are to mine.

Demoman's Purification.name: block_blast_resistance
Demoman's Purification.description: Pushes how resistant blocks of that block type are to explosions.

Plumber's Purification.name: blockstate_waterlogged
Plumber's Purification.description: Pushes whether the block is waterlogged, or null if the block can not be waterlogged.

Orientation Purification.name: blockstate_rotation
Orientation Purification.description: Pushes the vector of the block's facing direction, or null if the block does not have a facing direction.

Farmer's Purification.name: blockstate_crop
Farmer's Purification.description: Pushes a number 0 to 1, corresponding to how grown that crop is, as well as beehives, composters, and cauldrons. Strangely works on cakes too.

Luminance Purification (blockstate_glow).name: blockstate_glow
Luminance Purification (blockstate_glow).description: Pushes a boolean for whether the block is in a "lit" state, for example furnaces, Redstone torches, lamps, and campfires.

Lock Purification.name: blockstate_lock
Lock Purification.description: Pushes a boolean for whether the block is currently in a "open" state, for example doors, trapdoors, fence gates, and open barrels.

Angle Purification.name: blockstate_turn
Angle Purification.description: Pushes a number corresponding to the rotation of signs, skulls, and banners.

Bunching Purification.name: blockstate_bunch
Bunching Purification.description: Pushes how many are in a bunch block, or null otherwise. Useful only for candles, sea pickles, and turtle eggs.

Book Purification.name: blockstate_book
Book Purification.description: Pushes a boolean for whether lecterns or jukeboxes have a book/music disc in them respectively. Rumors say it works for some kind of magic bookshelf too.

Thaumaturgist's Purification.name: get_enchantments
Thaumaturgist's Purification.description: Gets a list of enchantments the item has.

Charm Distillation.name: get_enchantment_strength
Charm Distillation.description: Gets the strength of the specific enchantment on the item.

Calorie Purification.name: get_hunger
Calorie Purification.description: Takes in an item identifier and pushes the amount it will fill you.

Satiation Purification.name: get_saturation
Satiation Purification.description: Takes in an item identifier and pushes the saturation value, which roughly affects how long it will fill you.

Flesh Purification.name: is_meat
Flesh Purification.description: Takes in an item identifier and pushes whether it's considered a meat (wolves can eat it).

Dessert Purification.name: is_snack
Dessert Purification.description: Takes in an item identifier and pushes whether it's a snack (you can eat it really quickly).

Inferno Purification.name: is_burning
Inferno Purification.description: Pushes whether the entity is burning. Also applies to entities that are visually on fire, even if they are immune to fire like blazes attacking.

Inferno Purification II.name: burning_time
Inferno Purification II.description: Pushes how long in seconds the entity will continue burning if not put out.

Enderman's Purification.name: is_wet
Enderman's Purification.description: Pushes whether the entity is touching rain, water, or in a bubble column.

Vitality Purification.name: get_health
Vitality Purification.description: Pushes how close an entity is to death. I can think of these in terms of half-hearts.

Fitness Purification.name: get_max_health
Fitness Purification.description: Pushes how much health an entity can have at its prime. I can think of these in terms of half-hearts.

Suffocation Purification.name: get_air
Suffocation Purification.description: Pushes how many seconds before an entity starts to suffocate. This applies to fish out of water as well as land creatures in water.

Lung Purification.name: get_max_air
Lung Purification.description: Pushes how many seconds an entity can last outside their normal breathing environment before they start suffocating.

Sloth's Purification.name: is_sleeping
Sloth's Purification.description: Pushes whether the entity is sleeping. Applies to players, cats, foxes, and a variety of other creatures.

Racer's Purification.name: is_sprinting
Racer's Purification.description: Pushes whether the entity is sprinting. Includes if I am swimming or if I have left the ground since sprinting and extends to cats, foxes, and more.

Youth Purification.name: is_baby
Youth Purification.description: Pushes whether a living creature is in its baby form. Also works on armor stands oddly.

Reproduction Purification.name: breedable
Reproduction Purification.description: Pushes whether an animal creature is in love and ready to mate, or null if that creature is not capable of that type of reproduction.

Hunger Purification.name: get_player_hunger
Hunger Purification.description: Pushes how full a player is. I can imagine this as individual hunger hunches.

Stamina Purification.name: get_player_saturation
Stamina Purification.description: Pushes my saturation, which roughly correlates to how long the player will remain full.

Warehouse Purification.name: count_max_stack
Warehouse Purification.description: Takes in an item entity and pushes how many items that can stack in it.

Fragility Purification.name: damage_max_stack
Fragility Purification.description: Takes in an item entity and pushes how much durability the item can have at its peak.

Edibility Purification.name: edible
Edibility Purification.description: Takes in an item identifier and pushes whether you can eat it.

Diagnosis Purification.name: get_effects_entity
Diagnosis Purification.description: Pushes a list of status effects the entity is afflicted with.

Prescription Purification.name: get_effects_item
Prescription Purification.description: Pushes a list of status effects the food or potion will bestow.

Condition Purification.name: get_effect_category
Condition Purification.description: Pushes the general "goodness" of the effect towards the afflicted. -1 for harmful, 0 for neutral, and 1 for beneficial.

Concentration Distillation.name: get_effect_amplifier
Concentration Distillation.description: Pushes the potency of the specific effect acting on the entity or null if the entity doesn't have it.

Clearance Distillation.name: get_effect_duration
Clearance Distillation.description: Pushes how long the effect will last in seconds or null if the entity doesn't have it.

Janus' Gambit.name: janus
Janus' Gambit.description: Instantly terminates the Hex regardless of current circumstances, breaking even through Thoth's, Themis', and Hermes' Gambit unlike Charon's Gambit.

Sisyphus' Gambit.name: sisyphus
Sisyphus' Gambit.description: Takes a pattern list and casts it over and over forever until it encounters either a Charon's Gambit or a Janus' Gambit.

Themis' Gambit.name: themis
Themis' Gambit.description: Takes a list and a pattern or pattern list which is used to sort the list by casting over every iota similar to Thoth's Gambit.
